name: Shawn Colvin
description: '''Shawna Lee "Shawn" Colvin''' (born January 10, 1956) is an American singer and songwriter. She began her career performing in several [[folk music|folk]] and [[rock music|rock]] bands throughout the 1970s and 1980s before touring with [[Suzanne Vega]] in 1988, which landed her a recording contract with [[Columbia Records]]. Her debut studio album ''[[Steady On (Shawn Colvin album)|Steady On]]'' (1989) received the [[Grammy Award for Best Contemporary Folk Album]]. Her subsequent albums ''[[Fat City (Shawn Colvin album)|Fat City]]'' (1992) and ''[[Cover Girl (Shawn Colvin album)|Cover Girl]]'' (1994) saw moderate commercial success before Colvin's fourth studio album ''[[A Few Small Repairs]]'' (1996) saw the large success of the single "[[Sunny Came Home]]", which received the [[Grammy Award for Song of the Year]] and [[Grammy Award for Record of the Year|Record of the Year]]. Colvin's career also gained a following in the 1990s after she performed during all three original iterations of the [[Lilith Fair]] music festival. Following the release of her fifth studio album ''[[Whole New You]]'' (2001), Colvin signed with [[Nonesuch Records]] for her next two studio albums ''[[These Four Walls (Shawn Colvin album)|These Four Walls]]'' (2006) and ''[[All Fall Down (Shawn Colvin album)|All Fall Down]]'' (2012), both of which saw continued moderate success. Her most recent studio releases include ''[[Uncovered (Shawn Colvin album)|Uncovered]]'' (2015) and ''[[The Starlighter]]'' (2018). [[William Morrow and Company|William Morrow]] published Colvin's memoir ''Diamond in the Rough'' in 2012 to a positive reception.
